intro: Fagara limoncello, commonly known as the lemon-scented fagara, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, lemon-scented leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in humid, shaded forest environments. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
